description: Middle English, from Old French letanie, from Ancient Greek λιτανεία (litaneía, “prayer”), from λιτή (litḗ, “prayer, entreaty”).

entries.meaning: A ritual liturgical prayer in which a series of prayers recited by a leader are alternated with responses from the congregation.

examples: The litany of packaging innovations introduced to or popularized in the U.S. food market over the last generation seems endless: flexible aseptic packaging, barrier plastics, squeezables, lightweight glass, the retort pouch,  […]
